t: Joel 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel son of Pethuel:
A Plague of Locusts
Hear*pn this, you elders; listen,*ln all you inhabitants of the land. Has*ln anything like this ever happened in your days or*ln in the days of your ancestors?
Tell*ln your children about it, and*ln let your children tell their children, and*ln their children the next generation.

What*ln the devouring locust has left, the*ln swarming locust has eaten; what*ln the swarming locust has left, the*ln young locust has eaten; and*ln what the young locust has left, the*ln destroying locust has eaten.
Wake*pn up, you drunkards, and weep; wail,*ln all you wine drinkers, because*ln of the sweet wine, for*ln it has been taken from your mouth.
For*ln a nation has invaded my land, powerful*ln and without number; its*ln teeth are the teeth of a lion, and*ln it has the fangs of a lioness.
It*ln has devastated my grapevine and*ln splintered my fig tree. It*ln has stripped off its bark and thrown it away; its*ln branches have turned white.
Grieve*ln like a young woman dressed in sackcloth, mourning*ln for the husband of her youth.
Grain*ln and drink offerings have been cut off from*ln the house of the Lord;*s the*ln priests, who are ministers of the Lord,*s mourn.
The*ln fields are destroyed; the*ln land grieves; indeed,*ln the grain is destroyed; the*ln new wine is dried up; and*ln the fresh oil fails.
Be*ln ashamed, you farmers, wail,*ln you vinedressers, over*ln the wheat and the barley, because*ln the harvest of the field has perished.
The*ln grapevine is dried up, and*ln the fig tree is withered; the*ln pomegranate, the date palm, and the apple— all*ln the trees of the orchard — have withered. Indeed,*ln human joy has dried up.

Dress*pn in sackcloth and lament, you priests; wail,*ln you ministers of the altar. Come*ln and spend the night in sackcloth, you*ln ministers of my God, because*ln grain and drink offerings are*ln withheld from the house of your God.
Announce*ln a sacred fast; proclaim*ln a solemn assembly! Gather*ln the elders and*ln all the residents of the land at*ln the house of the Lord*s your God, and*ln cry out to the Lord.*s
The Day of the Lord
Woe*pn because of that day! For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near and*ln will come as devastation from the Almighty.
Hasn’t*ln the food been cut off before*ln our eyes, joy*ln and gladness from*ln the house of our God?
The*ln seeds lie shriveled in their casings. The*ln storehouses are in ruin, and*ln the granaries are broken down, because*ln the grain has withered away.
How*ln the animals groan! The*ln herds of cattle wander in confusion since*ln they have no pasture. Even*ln the flocks of sheep and goats suffer punishment.
I*ln call to you, Lord,*s for*ln fire has consumed the*ln pastures of the wilderness, and*ln flames have devoured all*ln the trees of the orchard.
Even*ln the wild animals cry out to you, for*ln the river beds are dried up, and*ln fire has consumed the*ln pastures of the wilderness.
